summary: The Streamline Emergency Care Act authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to nonprofit healthcare providers with existing emergency departments. These grants, up to $500,000 each, can be used for hiring and retaining staff, modernizing facilities, and providing training to improve patient care and flow. The Secretary must submit a report on the program's effectiveness after three years, and $20 million is authorized to be appropriated annually from 2026-2030.
